action.action-desc: Mr. Perry introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To designate Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Countering Russian Terrorism Act.

section.header: Designation as state sponsor of terrorism
section.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall designate Russia as a country the government of which has repeatedly provided support for international terrorism pursuant toâ€”

paragraph.text: section 1754(c)(1)(A) of the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 (50 U.S.C. 4318(c)(1)(A));
section 620A of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2371);
section 40 of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2780); and
any other applicable provision of law.

section.text: It is the sense of Congress that the President should immediately break off all diplomatic ties with the Russian Federation.
